title: An Introduction to Angular Material Form-Fields

title: Learn How to Click a Button when Angular Unit Testing
desc: Buttons play a large part in the user experience of your user interface. Angular makes working with buttons extremely easy, but perhaps you've hit a wall when your mindset switches to testing. Should you have unit test cases for button clicks in your Angular application? Is it really that important? And if so, how would you go about testing that scenario?

title: Secure and Deploy Micro Frontends with Angular

We use Webpack 5 with Module Federation to wire the micro frontends together, demonstrate sharing authenticated state between the different front ends, prepare for deployment using dynamic module loading, and deploy it all to Vercel's free hosting plan.

title: S3 E10 - Empowering More Kids to Learn Code

Angular's Vision for the Future
desc:
In the Angular 2021 recap and 2022 preview post, we shared our plans for 2022. As we are almost midway through 2022, this is a great time to give more insights into our long-term plan and some hints of what we might work on in 2023.

title: Angular: Difference between Observables and Promises in a nutshell
desc: If you've ever used the Angular framework to build web applications, you've probably noticed that it has a built-in RxJS library that enables reactive programming. It allows us to use Observables to handle asynchronous requests, instead of Promises. Of course, we can also use the second method, but what's the difference? In this article, I will try to answer this question.

title: Angular — composing directives with DI
desc: In one of my projects we had the need to restrict number inputs. Therefore, we decided to add some custom directives. In this article I will show you how we've built the different directives and how we've handled the similar logic.

title: VS Code Configuration for .NET/Angular Projects
desc: In summary, we want to create the configurations to build/run our .NET API and Angular frontend individually, and then create a Workspace with a compound configuration to run them both. This will let us build/run our full stack application with a single F5 click.

title: Fetching Data from a Backend API in Angular App
desc: Communicating with backend services using HTTP. Most front-end applications need to communicate with a server over the HTTP protocol, to download or upload data and access other back-end services. title: How to disable events in Angular — Fran Prieto
desc:
Sometimes we have an event bound to an element and for any reason we have to avoid that this event is triggered, so we have to disable that event. To do such tasks, in vanilla JavaScript we have a method like preventDefault(). We will see how to disable events in Angular.
(photo: by Gerd Altmann found in Pixabay)

title: A Table with Expandable and Collapsible Rows Using Angular

We also tap into his experience as a leader to help you identify ways to be a better manager yourself.

title: Change Detection without Change Detection
desc: In Angular, we have the powerful change detection mechanism to help us rerender the UI when data changes. ... This process is overall known as change detection. Notice that the change detector will definitely be invoked in situations where no changes have been made at all, making it less efficient than we would ideally want.
